section: The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The contract states it begins September 1, 2004, but the agreement is entered into on January 13, 2005. The term is for a period of years and months redacted, but the termination date is also redacted. This makes it impossible to verify that the commencement and termination dates are consistent with the stated term length. This omission creates ambiguity and internal inconsistency about the actual duration of the agreement.

section: During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall exclusively play/use the MANDATORY PRODUCT. (It is expressly understood by the parties that CONSULTANT may play [* ****] clubs in the bag other than ADAMS GOLF clubs including, but not limited to, a putter by a manufacturer other than ADAMS GOLF but may not endorse those clubs and/or putter.)
explanation: This section requires the Consultant to exclusively use 'Mandatory Products,' which are defined in Section 2C. However, it also states the consultant may play clubs that are not Adams Golf clubs. By not identifying the number of acceptable clubs, this is a contradiction within the text.

section: During the term of this Agreement, ADAMS GOLF shall provide CONSULTANT  with [*****] sets of clubs for CONSULTANT'S family and friends each calendar year of this Agreement.
explanation: The omission of the number of club sets creates uncertainty regarding the specific quantity of clubs Adams Golf is obligated to provide. This lack of clarity can lead to disputes and difficulties in enforcing the contractual obligation, as the intended quantity remains undefined.
